meanings.definition: An act of removing dirt or unwanted items from a space.
meanings.sent1: After the cleanout, the room looked much tidier.
meanings.sent2: The cleanout of the garage took all day.
meanings.sent3: I never realized how much stuff I had until the cleanout!
meanings.sent4: Her cleanout of negative thoughts left her feeling refreshed.
meanings.sent5: The cleanout revealed hidden treasures among the clutter.

meanings.definition: A place where waste or unwanted items are disposed of.
meanings.sent1: The cleanout behind the building is always overflowing.
meanings.sent2: We took the old furniture to the cleanout down the street.
meanings.sent3: The cleanout smelled terrible, but it was necessary for the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The cleanout was like a bottomless pit for all our junk.
meanings.sent5: The cleanout was a haven for scavengers looking for discarded items.

meanings.definition: To remove dirt or unwanted items from a space.
meanings.sent1: I need to cleanout my closet before it gets too messy.
meanings.sent2: She decided to cleanout the old shed in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cleanout the garage, but ended up making more of a mess.
meanings.sent4: The storm cleanout the debris from the yard in one swift motion.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to cleanout the entire office over the weekend.
